text.p: BellSouth Corp of the U.S. planned to spend between $100 million and $150 million in 1997 on a campaign to keep its customers from switching to rival telephone companies, the New York Times said on Monday.

"We know that the long-distance companies, when they come into the region, are going to spend a lot of money in advertising," William Pate, vice president of advertising at BellSouth, was quoted as saying in the paper.

Most of the money would be spent in the southeast, the newspaper said. BellSouth has already signed three-year sponsorship agreements with baseball teams the Atlanta Braves and the Florida Marlins, and a car-racing team, it said.
